comments.body: The moss can be removed with flint and steel or shears. The moss can also spread over time. The crafting recipe is shapeless.
Good, but what about Mossy Stone or other blocks that are missing mossy variants like Deepslate and Tuff.

Of course, this means they would be adding Mossy Copper, Exposed Mossy Copper, Weathered Mossy Copper, Oxidized Mossy Copper, Waxed Mossy Copper, Waxed Exposed Mossy Copper, Waxed Weathered Mossy Copper, and Waxed Oxidized Mossy Copper.
It can be made into a mossy version of a mossy copper pillar, similar to how 2 copper blocks could make a Copper Pillar.
Add Mossy tuff

Other Properties:

  • Flammable: No 
  • Catches fire from lava: No 
  • Stackable to 64
  • Luminous: No
  • Transparent: No
  • Pickaxe is the assigned tool, a minimum of a stone pickaxe is required for the block to drop
  • Renewable: Yes
  • Piston Movable: Yes
  • Immune to Explosions: No
  • Immune to Wither: No
  • Immune to Ender Dragon: No
  • Blast Resistance: Same as the Copper Block
  • Hardness: Same as the Copper Block

You know what might be neat? Perhaps making the upgraded shield give passive defense in addition to the blocking mechanic. might be a bit broken though.

I think the progression should be: Base Shield -> Shield with armadillo scute -> Shield with turtle scute
 
Since all you need to get the armadillo scute is the brush, and for the turtles you need a longer process
 
I think the banners should be kept. When you upgrade the shield, its base texture changes, but the gray edges could also change, so that when you use a banner, you can tell what type of shield it is by the edges. 
 
And really, I think the only thing that should change the shield for the better is an increase in durability and maybe more resistance to axes.
that's a really cool idea, maybe they could have like a slow animation like the sea lantern has, and be a shade of blue like glow squids?
Also, you could add a armor trim that glows.

Ikr, the Netherite Upgrade Template is way too hard to get. Maybe make it so you can also get it from a nether fortress chest. like, some people want to raid bastions with netherite armor, but can't because they have to raid it first.
It should spawn in ruined portals and bonus chests.
Dude i feel ya and first you need so many resources to even get netherite

It is important to note that this topic has already been covered by other Registered Users on the Minecraft Feeback site. Still, I felt the need to address this issue in a formal and respectful manner in order to create a definitive location for discussion.
this is a great idea!
100%, though maybe without the damage.
This should kill the arthropod instantly, not just damage it.
The sniffer deserves way better, and this would make them much more interesting!!!
Horse armor trims please!

I believe templates should work like reforging equipment from blueprints.
For example, we can reforge a sword into a saber or a sickle, changing the damage and attack speed; Add visors to helmets, reducing visibility but increasing protection; Spikes on boots, eliminating slipping on ice, but eliminating stealthy steps due to knocking.
You improve one, you make the other worse.
I believe that elytras should quickly deteriorate from arrows, blows, fire, even without any magical effects.
Good idea
The stem would be blueish.
it needs a new light purple dye too
i would like them to be easer to find
This is a good idea. In early game I need a bucket but iron can be difficult to find sometimes and when it is found is precious and saved for things like tools.
Will it work on pocket, just sneak and tap sign when I make typo?
An old bread recipe would give us a wheat cake, in prehistoric times they were dried in the sun. And the new bread recipe could include an egg and sugar, it would be more satisfying.

Now that they added the mud bricks, they should really switch to making the seeds the part in the bread recipe, since the current wheat item is clearly the straw/hay part, which suggests the current un-cooked bread recipe is more like a basket than a food item. I can't see much point in making the process in the game as complicated as in real life (milling the seeds to flour, adding water and other ingredients to make dough, baking the dough), but I think your suggestion of at least adding the "dough" phase requiring baking would be an improvement.
^The wheat is harvested along with the stalks, only then the seeds are separated by threshing with a flail.
This is a cool idea, but how would it work?

I expect they could add some item to the game that makes use of a focused screenshot and saves the resulting image file similar to the way they handle maps, which would at least allow the player to accumulate some paintings of their world without elaborate modding. I don't think such a system would work well for automatically generating pictures of the world for villagers to display, unfortunately, although perhaps it would still be amusing if the player "paints" a picture of his or her base and villagers the world over decorate their houses with copies.

I don't know if they could make an automated system that would always select good angles with no obstructions for making pictures, but they could presumably add a system that allowed players to take such 'snapshots' and store them as an image file like a map for later reproduction. They'd probably need to change the way paintings currently work, or at least make a second type of painting entity for player-made images, as it could get very frustrating to try to get a specific painting if you've added dozens or hundreds of pictures of builds or cool landscapes and whatnot.
It could rather be that it uses more durability than normal.
If used in a furnace, it would have a very rare chance of exploding.
to make it easier, maybe a few copper ingots instead of a copper block

this is genius, but I think it should not have the function to control the allay cuz that would be too op, instead there cold be a way to make the allay follow the player like how cows would with wheat, and when you give the allay the item to see with it it would appear in a minimap style thing instead of just changing you entire POV. Alternatively it could be a saddle like item where you need to use some sort of thing to be able to actually control the allay, and even with it, you wont be able to make the allay go over 200-500 block away from the player
